data.title: Rest in Peace Chris Penn
data.meta_description: Hey folks. Quint here with some pretty shocking and sad news. Chris Penn apparently collapsed and died in Santa Monica today. Chris Penn was in many films in the '80s, including a leading role in the Cameron Crowe-scripted flick about high...
data.text:
Published at: Jan. 24, 2006, 9:11 p.m. CST by staff

Hey folks. Quint here with some pretty shocking and sad news. Chris Penn apparently collapsed and died in Santa Monica today.

Chris Penn was in many films in the '80s, including a leading role in the Cameron Crowe-scripted flick about high school life THE WILD LIFE. The other Cameron Crowe-scripted flick about high school life starring a Penn, FAST TIMES AT RIDGEMONT HIGH became very well known while this one fell through the cracks. He also had small roles in RUMBLE FISH, FOOTLOOSE and BEST OF THE BEST.

Despite his work in the '80s, it wasn't until he hooked up with Quentin Tarantino in his first big film that he really broke out. He played Nice Guy Eddie in RESERVOIR DOGS and will be quoted for generations. He also appeared in the Tarantino-scripted TRUE ROMANCE. He went on to become a well-used character actor in films like RUSH HOUR and STARSKY & HUTCH.

He was only 40 years old. My thoughts are with his friends, family and fans.
